summary: This bill, the "No Frivolous Application for Short-Barreled Shotguns Act," aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code and U.S. Code to reduce regulations on short-barreled shotguns. Key provisions include removing them from the definition of firearms under the National Firearms Act, eliminating certain disparate treatments, preventing state laws from imposing taxes or registration requirements on them, and mandating the destruction of certain related records. The bill also specifies that acquiring a shotgun in accordance with federal law meets state and local registration or licensing requirements.
